overview: This subject introduces students to the methodologies needed in applied musicology through the implementation and presentation both orally and in writing of a number of small-scale research projects (such as programme notes, talks, research assistance, material for the web) as directed and appropriate to their area of research.
The research project topics and timelines are agreed upon in collaboration between student and supervisor at the commencement of the semester.
intended learning outcomes: skills to be able to plan and construct a conference paper;
ability and self-confidence to present a lucid oral presentation;
ability to carry out a prescribed research task;
knowledge of what is required to submit work to a scholarly publication.

assessments.description: A written folio of work completed during the semester. 3000 words (equivalent)
A written reflective commentary on what was achieved by the research projects. 1500 words (equivalent)

Semester 2.Contact hours: 6 hours, comprising one 1-hour seminar per fortnight

Prescribed texts: There are no specifically prescribed or recommended texts for this subject.
